revised_title: Royal Society's Relocation and the State of Science in 19th Century Britain
tldr: In 1856, Lord Wrottesley addressed the Royal Society about the relocation of the society to Burlington House, discussing the progress of the move and the benefits it would bring to science. He also touched upon the government's role in supporting science and the need for public support for education in physical sciences. The address also mentioned the British Association's report on improving the position of science and its cultivators in the country.
